bluebird.layers.layer.Layer¶

class bluebird.layers.layer.Layer¶

Bases: object

Default layer, that all other layers and activations inherit

Example

class CustomLayer(Layer):
def build(self, input_size) -> None:

super().__init__() … Make sure you do initialize input_size(it’s inherited from previous layer)

def forward(self, inputs: Tensor, training: bool = False) -> Tensor:

… when data is passing forward

def backward(self, grad: Tensor) -> Tensor:

… Make shoure you calculate gradients for weights and biases if needed … (self.grads[‘w’] and self.grads[‘b’])

__init__() → None¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

Methods

__init__()

Initialize self.

backward(grad)

Backpropagates the gradinet through the layer

build(input_size)

Used to finalize building layers

forward(inputs[, training])

Produces output for inputs

Backpropagates the gradinet through the layer
